title: Trust in the Organisation and the Role of Human Resource Management: Exploring the Rhetoric and Reality
abstractText:
The outcomes from this seminar series include: Searle and Skinner’s (2011) edited book with Edward Elgar Trust and HRM  comprising eighteen chapters bringing together research from a range of contexts and countries featuring many our keynotes as contributors; Searle and Dietz’s forthcoming special issue of the Journal of HRM. Collaborations that have arisen from these meetings of academics and practitioners have resulted in a number of symposium and conference papers at a range of UK and international events.

Members of the organising team have gone on to become key contributors in a group that have undertaken the Chartered Institute of Personnel and Development’s (CIPD) recent study on trust repair (Where has all the trust gone?); the formation and development of a standing working group on Organisational Trust for the European Group of Organization Studies (EGOS). There are also a number of bids in development and under considerationto to fund new research that has emerged as a result of the series.

The seminar has assisted in gaining access to organisations, as well as in the formation of new academic partnerships. The series has also created a popular resource from academics teaching in HRM or trust with slides and podcasts from each seminar:  http://www.open.ac.uk/socialsciences/trustinhrm/index.php.
